moves.1. e4 c5 2. b4: The uncommon, and dubious wing gambit.
moves.2... cxb4 3. c3: This is new! But against the fundamental opening ideas.. we want control of the center!
moves.3... d5: .. I'll fight for that control, thank you!
moves.4. exd5 Qxd5 5. Nf3 e5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2: White's position is terribly cramped.. He has obvious troubles developing.
moves.8... Nf6 9. O-O Be7 10. Bb2: A very poor developing move.. The bishop is staring at its own color pawn! It's not good here!
moves.10... O-O 11. h3: Not sure of the purpose of this move.
moves.12. Kh1 Qh4 13. Nc4 Nd5 14. Ne3: A terrible mistake. The crucial h2-b8 diagonal becomes under heavy, undefendable fire now, because of the lack of pawns and pieces (dark bishop sitting on b2, remember that?) around it!
moves.14... Nxe3 15. fxe3 Bd6: I'm threatening Qg3, as well as Bxh3. Rf4 is the only way to defend.
